process.title: How Development Actually Works | AxonDigital
process.description: A realistic guide to how digital products are actually built — what to expect, what you’ll get, and how to collaborate effectively with a digital agency.

hero.title: How Digital Product Development Actually Works
hero.description: What clients need to know about the development process: realistic expectations, common misconceptions, key phases, and the role of your team. Based on 100+ real-world projects.

items.title: 1. Why This Section Exists
items.description: Why we created this page: to align expectations and avoid misunderstandings.

items.title: 2. What You Should Know About Development
items.description: Development is not a button — it's a process of analysis, design, implementation, and iteration.

items.title: 3. Myths and Unrealistic Expectations
items.description: Why bugs always exist, why ideal is impossible, and why freeze-and-forget doesn’t work.

items.title: 4. Agile vs Waterfall: Why We Work Iteratively
items.description: Agile enables flexibility, early delivery, and feedback loops — essential in modern projects.

items.title: 5. How to Stay Agile Without Chaos
items.description: Boundaries, versioning, hypothesis-driven changes — how to stay flexible without losing focus.

items.title: 6. Our Development Process Step by Step
items.description: From pre-project analysis to support — full breakdown of how we build digital systems.

items.title: 7. Roles and Responsibilities
items.description: What the agency is responsible for — and what the client needs to do.

items.title: 8. What's Included — And What’s Not
items.description: Where our scope ends. Why tech ≠ marketing. What you should plan separately.

items.title: 9. Product as Part of Your Marketing Ecosystem
items.description: How your website or platform fits into the bigger picture. Why strategy comes first.

items.title: 10. Agency Standards and Practices
items.description: Stack, architecture, security, testing, CI/CD — our internal standards.

items.title: 11. Recommended Reading
items.description: External links to Agile Manifesto, bug management, testing practices, and more.
